metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4852 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
The WLS Security component in Oracle WebLogic Server 10.3.6.0, 12.1.2.0,12.1.3.0, and 12.2.1.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrarycommands via a crafted serialized Java object in T3 protocol traffic to TCPport 7001, related tooracle_common/modules/com.bea.core.apache.commons.collections.jar. NOTE:the scope of this CVE is limited to the WebLogic Server product.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcommons-collections3-java - 3.2.2-1
No subscription required

libcommons-collections4-java - 4.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcommons-collections3-java package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.2-1').
libcommons-collections4-java package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1-1').
openjdk-8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
